BuyingGuide.Name: Coins Buying Guide
BuyingGuide.Title: Coins Buying Guide
BuyingGuide.Text:
Coins have been used as currency for thousands of years, and collecting these tiny pieces of history has become a popular pastime. For many, coin collecting is a true passion, a real-life treasure hunt. Since it is relatively inexpensive to start a collection, shoppers can collect countless varieties of coins from all over the world through travel, by visiting local hobby stores, or by purchasing them online using websites like eBay.

When searching for coins, buyers should be aware of all available options before making a purchase. Find out about the different coin types, the value of coins, the most sought-after coins, common terms coin collectors should know, and places to find and buy coins.
 

History of Coins

While the Chinese are believed to be the first civilization to utilize coins in mass circulation, cultures throughout history have used coins in trade, as opposed to the barter system. Coins throughout the various ages of history have taken many varied forms and sizes. One common practice used with early coins was to drill a hole through the center to allow multiple coins to be placed on a string for easier transport.

Coins have also been made of a vast variety of metals, from gold and silver to copper and even tin. Coins throughout time have also varied in shape. For the most part, coins have been historically round, but some societies used rectangular coins or shaped coins resembling animals, such as cows.
 

Discover Collectible Coins

With the large variety of coins available, from ancient to modern, collectors may wa...

BuyingGuide.Name: Should I Buy a Table...
BuyingGuide.Title: Should I Buy a Tablet with Wi-Fi or with 3G?
BuyingGuide.Text:
Are you ready to join the tablet revolution? Every since Apple released its groundbreaking iPad on April 3, 2010, the face of mobile computing has undergone a massive revolution thanks to sleek, easy-to-use, and ultra hip tablet computers. However, unlike laptops before them, trying to decide whether to buy a tablet with Wi-Fi only or with 3G and Wi-Fi is tough. There are clear positives and negatives to each decision and indeed many of the most well-known tech insiders from the likes of PC World and ReadWriteWeb cannot even decide on the best way to go.

For buyers engaging in the 3G vs. Wi-Fi debate, this buying guide is designed to help. It will begin by reviewing the basic history of tablet computers along with reviewing the definitions of 3G and Wi-Fi for those who are still confused. Next, a discussion of the pros and cons of each choice as well as the nature of the 3G vs. Wi-Fi debate will further help readers gain perspective on this issue. Finally, a solution will be offered along with buying tips that are designed to help buyers get the most out of the tablet experience.


A Brief History of Tablet Computers

Before 2010, most people had never ...

BuyingGuide.Name: Unlocked iPhone Buyi...
BuyingGuide.Title: Unlocked iPhone Buying Guide
BuyingGuide.Text:
Most often, when cell phone users purchase an iPhone, they purchase it alongside a cell phone service plan. However, since the debut of the iPhone, there has been an increasing demand for "unlocked" iPhones. Locked iPhones are locked to a specific provider’s network. If the user leaves the provider’s coverage area, they lose service. Unlocked iPhones can be used with any carrier’s network, whether in the U.S or abroad.

The following guide offers some insight into the process of buying an unlocked iPhone. It includes information on what an unlocked iPhone is, the advantages and limitations of an unlocked iPhone, and how to go about finding an unlocked iPhone online.





What Is a...

BuyingGuide.Name: 5 Common Symptoms of...
BuyingGuide.Title: 5 Common Symptoms of a Malfunctioning Fuel Pump
BuyingGuide.Text:
The fuel pump is an integral element of any car or truck. Given the responsibility of literally pumping a vehicle’s fuel from its tank to the engine, a malfunctioning fuel pump will always lead to total disaster. Therefore, drivers need to be aware of the common symptoms of a malfunctioning fuel pump so as to address the problem before it leads to a car or truck that won’t start.

This guide is designed to explain the 5 most common signs of a failing fuel pump in an effort to educate drivers. That process begins with an explanation of the role and function of the fuel pump itself, which will help vehicle owners to understand the reasons behind fuel pump malfunction. Next, 5 common symptoms of a malfunctioning fuel pump, including everything from engine misfires to cars that won’t start, will be described. By the end of this guide, car and truck owners will understand what symptoms to look for in their own vehicles so that they can catch a fuel pump malfunction before it leads to total vehicle failure.

All About Fuel Pumps

The fuel pump is an essential component of any vehicle with an internal combustion engine, principally, cars and trucks. With the job of forcing fuel from the gas tank towards the engine, a malfunctioning fuel pump will create a situation where the engine either gets too much o...

BuyingGuide.Name: How to Tell the Diff...
BuyingGuide.Title: How to Tell the Difference Between Faux Leather and Real Leather
BuyingGuide.Text:
It is not always easy to distinguish between faux leather and real leather. It can be quite frustrating to purchase looks like a genuine leather vest, only to later realize it is actually synthetic. Authentic leather is much more expensive than faux, so it is important to tell the difference between the two. Shoppers will be able to easily identify real and faux leather by mastering a few simple tips. Learning how to distinguish real leather from faux leather will ensure an efficient and enjoyable buying experience.
 

Real Leather

Genuine leathers are made from the skins of animals, such as cattle, goats, sheep, and pigs. There are many types of leather, but it can generally be categorized into three types: aniline, semi-aniline, and pigmented. When choosing which type of leather to purchase, consider the desired appearance, and how often the leather will be used.

Aniline Leather

Aniline leather is high quality, top-grain leather that has no protective treatment applied. It is the most natural looking leather. Aniline finishes allow the natural leather markings to show. The leather is susceptible to surface scratches and easily absorbs stains. It is also prone to fading if in the sun for an extended p...

BuyingGuide.Name: 5 Benefits of Buying...
BuyingGuide.Title: 5 Benefits of Buying an Unlocked Phone
BuyingGuide.Text:
Some countries, such as Belgium, forbid the sale of locked cell phones. Many countries, however, do allow carriers to lock cell phones and, for some individuals, this is a problem. If a consumer uses a GSM cell phone, owning an unlocked cell phone offers at least five different benefits that may be useful to cell phone owners. In the United States, however, not all providers offer GSM service, so consumers should carefully consider the service provider when purchasing an unlocked cell phone. In the United States, it can be difficult to find stores that sell unlocked cell phones. Because of this, eBay makes an excellent source to find a wide variety of unlocked cell phones at great prices.
 

Benefit 1: Use Any GSM Cell Phone with Any GSM Provider

Outside the United States, almost every cell phone provider uses a GSM network to offer cell phone coverage. This means that a GSM cell phone will work for any carrier in almost every country, if the cell phone is not locked to a specific carrier. For unlocked cell phones, changing phones to a different carrier is simple; all the cell phone owner has to do is take out the existing SIM card&l...

BuyingGuide.Name: How to Choose the Ri...
BuyingGuide.Title: How to Choose the Right Necklace Length
BuyingGuide.Text:
Choosing the right necklace length is an easy and effective way to frame your face, showcase your gemstones, and augment any outfit. This guide will assist you with your next necklace purchase. First, learn how and where different necklace lengths fall on the body for women and men. Second, discover guidelines for selecting the right necklace length for your specific neck, height, face and body type. And third, learn how to find and purchase the perfect necklace length on eBay.


Standard Necklace Lengths for Women

Necklace chains for women typically range from 10 to 48 inches and anywhere in between. Although some necklaces are sold in odd-inch lengths, most women’s necklaces are sold in even-inch lengths. The following are the most commonly sold necklace lengths and where they fall on the average female body:

Necklace Length

Position on the Body

10 to 14 inches

Wraps closely around the neck

BuyingGuide.Name: 8 Essential Features...
BuyingGuide.Title: 8 Essential Features Every Tablet Buyer Should Look For
BuyingGuide.Text:
Tablets have hit the personal computer market with a bang. Ever since Apple introduced the iPad in 2010, the tablet craze has grown at a meteoric rate. While the iPad still holds 66 percent of the tablet market-share, several other companies have jumped on the bandwagon and come out with their own models.

What has made the tablet so successful is its compact size, in addition to the ease of working with a touchscreen interface. No peripherals are needed to interface with the computer, as everything is done right on the monitor. This makes for a smaller, lighter unit, taking portability to the next level.

Make no mistake, though: while tablets are extremely useful, it is unlikely that they will ever fully replace full - sized computers . While they are great for what they do, they cannot compete with the computing power of a desktop, or even with that of a good laptop computer . Nor can one type as fast on a touchscreen as is possible with a tactile keyboard .

More than anything, tablets are used for surfing the net, checking email, and using media. While these categories cover a lot of ground, tablets are still weak when it comes to their ability to perform full-blown business applications .

Nevertheless, tablet sales topped 63 million units in 2011, with an increase of at least 40 percent project...

BuyingGuide.Name: 5 Common Digital Cam...
BuyingGuide.Title: 5 Common Digital Camera Buying Mistakes
BuyingGuide.Text:
Digital cameras are a great piece of technology to own. It’s simply great to be able to capture the important moments in your life. While most everyone has a camera on their cell phone, nothing takes the place of a camera with all the features and functions that make it a pleasure to use.

For the most part camera manufacturers don’t spend a lot of money advertising their products. There are the occasional television commercials and some magazine ads, mostly in sports and outdoor magazines, but for the most part camera companies depend on name recognition and salesmanship to move their products. Just a little research and preparation before heading into the store will save you from the soft sell and buying something you don’t really want.

This guide outlines the five most common mistakes shoppers make when buying a digital camera, and how to avoid making them. Additionally, it will give a few ideas of where to buy digital cameras and accessories at reasonable prices. This guide will set you on the way to finding the perfect digital camera for you.

1. Buying More Camera Than You Need

Okay, it’s time for a reality check. Unless you are a serious hobby photographer, or you have a job as football sideline photographer, there is only so much camera you need. Aside from the expense that comes with high-end, professional SLR cameras, they can become quite bulky to lug around, especially if you add in extra lenses, tripods and other accessories. For most people a...

BuyingGuide.Name: How to Create a PayP...
BuyingGuide.Title: How to Create a PayPal Account
BuyingGuide.Text:
PayPal is an online payment gateway and virtual wallet that serves millions of customers every day who are located in more than 190 countries and regions around the globe. Some common uses for a PayPal account include sending money to friends, family, and loved ones; receiving payments for work that has been completed; and buying and selling on eBay. PayPal allows account owners to link a bank account and credit or debit card to the account so that he or she can pay for goods and services from many merchants and private sellers from around the world without exposing private financial information.
PayPal is an eBay-owned company which was founded in 1998 and since then has been the preferred method of payment for all eBay auctions and fixed priced listings. This guide will demonstrate how quick and simple it is to create a PayPal account as well as the many uses and benefits that come along with being a PayPal account holder.


Where to Open a PayPal Account

The first step one should take to open a PayPal account is to navigate to the PayPal website. The first thing one will see when looking at the PayPal homepage is the three main services the company provides: pay online, send money, and get paid. Each of those headings will demonstrate to applicants how the company allows account holders to pay for eBay purchases and monthly subscriptions for items such as video game play and membership websites, send and receive money from friends, and get paid for freelance and independent contract work from employers. On the upper left side of the screen, there i...
